text: Listen to God Rather Than Uttering Rash Vows
\f + \fr 5:1 \ft \xt Ecclesiastes 5:1–20 \ft in the English Bible is 4:17–5:19 in the Hebrew Bible \f* Guard your steps when you go to the house of God;
draw near to listen \add rather\add* than to offer a sacrifice of fools,
for they do not know that they are doing evil.
Do not be rash with your mouth,
and do not let your heart be quick to utter a word before God.
For God is in heaven, and you \add are\add* on earth;
therefore, let your words be few.
For a dream comes with many cares,
and the voice of a fool with many words.
When you make a vow to God,
do not delay in fulfilling it,
for ⸤he takes no pleasure⸥\f + \fr 5:4 \ft Literally “there is no desire” \f* in fools.
Fulfill what you vow!
It is better that you not vow
than that you vow and not fulfill it.
Do not let your mouth lead your flesh into sin,
and do not tell the messenger that it \add was\add* a mistake.
Why anger God at your words,
so that he destroys the work of your hands?
For with many dreams \add come\add* vanities and numerous words.
Therefore, fear God!
Powerful Bureaucrats Exploit the Helpless Poor
Do not be surprised if you see the poor being oppressed with violence
or \add do not see\add* justice and righteousness in the province.
For one official is watched by a higher official,
and \add there are\add* even higher officials over them!
The produce of the land is exploited by everyone;
⸤even the king profits from the field \add of the poor\add*⸥!\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Literally “for the field is even worked for the king” \f*
There is Never Enough Money to Satisfy
Whoever loves money is not satisfied \add with\add* money,
and whoever loves wealth \add is\add* not \add satisfied with\add* profit.
This also \add is\add* vanity!
When prosperity increases,
those who consume it increase.
⸤So its owner gains nothing,
except to see his wealth before it is spent⸥.\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “And what gain has its owner but to see it with his eyes?” \f*
The sleep of the laborer \add is\add* pleasant, whether he eats little or much,
but the wealth of the rich man does not allow him to rest.
Hoarding Wealth Can Backfire
There is a grievous evil which I have seen under the sun: wealth ⸤hoarded⸥\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Literally “kept ” \f* by its owner to his harm.
That wealth was lost in a bad venture. Although he has borne a child, ⸤he has nothing to leave to him⸥.\f + \fr 5:14 \ft Literally “he has nothing in his hand” \f*
Just as he came from his mother’s womb naked, ⸤he will depart⸥\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Literally “return to go” \f* just as he came; he will take nothing with him for his toil.
This also \add is\add* a grievous illness. Exactly as he came, so he will go. What profit \add does\add* he gain for all his toil for the wind?
Also, he eats in darkness all his days; he is frustrated \add in\add* much sickness and resentment.
If You Have Wealth, Enjoy It as God Enables

Look! I have discovered what is good and fitting: to eat and to drink and ⸤to enjoy⸥\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Literally “to see goodness” \f* all \add the fruit of\add* the toil with which one toils under the sun during the number of the days of his life that God gives to him—for this \add is\add* his lot.\f + \fr 5:18 \ft Or “fate” \f*

This indeed is a gift of God: everyone to whom God gives wealth and possessions, he also empowers him ⸤to enjoy them⸥,\f + \fr 5:19 \ft Literally “to eat from it” \f* to accept his lot, and to rejoice in \add the fruit of\add* his toil.
For he does not remember the \add brief\add* days of his life, for God keeps his heart preoccupied with enjoyment \add of life\add*.
